name: African coconut chicken curry - Kuku Paka
description: Recipe video above. Are you ready to discover the world's easiest curry?? As in, a real one, made from scratch. Introducing - Kuku Paka! This chicken curry in a tomato coconut spiced sauce tastes like an Indian curry. Except it's African, and you can get everything you need from your regular grocery store. For a strictly traditional version, sear the chicken over charcoal for chargrilled flavour before adding into the sauce. To make this Monday-night-friendly, I've just pan-seared. Serves 4 hearty appetites or 5 to 6 regular servings.
recipeIngredient: 4  chicken thigh fillets (, skin-on and bone-in (~250g/8oz each) (Note 2))
2 tbsp coconut oil ((or vegetable, canola or other plain oil) (Note 1))
1 tsp pure chilli powder or cayenne pepper (, reduce or omit to taste (Note 3))
2 tbsp lemon juice ((sub apple cider vinegar))
1/2 cup (lightly packed) coriander/cilantro leaves ((sub parsley or baby spinach, or omit))

recipeInstructions.text: Season chicken - Pat chicken dry using paper towels then sprinkle with the salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Season chicken - Pat chicken dry using paper towels then sprinkle with the salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Brown chicken - Heat oil in a large heavy based pot over high heat. Add the thighs, skin-side down, and cook for 4-5 minutes until golden brown. Turn and cook the other side for 1 minute. Transfer to a plate (it will still be raw inside). Then brown the drumsticks as best you can. I do 3 sides, 2 minutes each side. Transfer to the plate.

recipeInstructions.text: SautÃ© aromatics - Turn heat down to medium high. Add the onion and cook for 1 minute until softened. Add garlic and ginger, cook for 30 seconds. Add the coriander, cumin, turmeric and chilli. Stir for 30 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Sauce - Add coconut milk, tomato and salt. Stir, then return chicken into the pot (including juices on the plate). Submerge chicken as best you can.

recipeInstructions.text: Simmer 30 min - Once the sauce comes to a simmer, reduce the heat so itâ€™s bubbling gently. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Remove the lid and simmer for a further 20 minutes, stirring occasionally to ensure the base doesn't catch.

review.reviewBody: Believe the hype... this curry is easy and YUMMY! I cooked it so we could try the frozen roti I'd purchased...then forgot all about the roti! But happy to have an excuse to make it again as roti would be a perfect accompaniment.

I have been making this curry for over a decade. An alternative thatâ€™s also good is skip coconut milk however add some fresh cream towards the end and finish off by simmering for a 2 mins. Delicious with rice or roti
